definition: (of a spirit or deity) to possess sb
to add/to attach/to be close to/to be attached
lit. body and soul separated (idiom); fig. scared out of one's wits/beside oneself

sentences.english: In primitive tribes, dreams were thought to be the indication of God or the haunting of the devil.
sentences.chinese: 在原始部落中，夢被當成天神降臨或是妖魔附體。

sentences.english: I was so scared that my blood ran cold .
sentences.chinese: 我真是給嚇得手腳冰冷，魂不附體。

sentences.english: Fox bewitching appendages is on UIMI body, close little younger brother is south immense forest.
sentences.chinese: 狐妖附體在UIMI身體上，並收林海南爲小弟。

sentences.english: Defending murderers and thieves would appall them.
sentences.chinese: 爲殺人犯和小偷辯護會使他們嚇得魂不附體。

sentences.english: For the first time in my life, I was terrified by a beautiful sunrise.
sentences.chinese: 我平生第一次被美麗的日出嚇得魂不附體。

sentences.english: A mouse scared her out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 一隻老鼠把她嚇得魂不附體。

sentences.english: To her horror, she saw her husband knocked down by a truck.
sentences.chinese: 見到丈夫被一輛卡車撞到在地，她嚇得魂不附體。

sentences.english: A sudden shout scared her out of her wits.
sentences.chinese: 一陣突然的叫聲嚇得她魂不附體。

sentences.english: The little girl cried when she saw her dying cat.
sentences.chinese: 小女孩看到那條蛇的時候，嚇得魂不附體。

sentences.english: In their panic and utter dejection, the apostles had not thought about it at all.
sentences.chinese: 驚嚇得魂不附體的宗徒們，根本沒有顧及到那麼多。

sentences.english: A miserable shout from nobody-knew-where scared him out of his wits.
sentences.chinese: 哪裏傳來了一聲慘嚎，嚇得他魂不附體。

sentences.english: She was scared out of wits.
If a person possessed Monster Monster it is very difficult to bring off .
sentences.chinese: 一個人如果爲魔怪附體很難再能把魔怪趕走。

sentences.english: When Jesus healed the demon-possessed dumb man, the multitudes marveled, saying.
sentences.chinese: 當耶穌治癒污鬼附體的啞巴，衆人都希奇，說。

sentences.english: Possessed by what we now no more possessed.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在沒有更多的附體附體。

sentences.english: Possessed by what we now no more possessed.
sentences.chinese: 我們現在沒有更多的附體附體。

definition: to play tricks on/to make fun of/to tease
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
to become visible/to appear/to manifest one's true nature
to cause an accident/to make trouble/to get into trouble
lit. a deluge of heavenly flowers (idiom)/fig. extravagant embellishments/hype
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
